meanings.definition: To establish or designate as a homeport.
meanings.sent1: The navy ship was homeported in the bustling harbor.
meanings.sent2: The cruise ship is homeported in Miami, Florida.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous pirate decided to homeport his ship in a hidden cove.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was homeported in the small seaside town where she grew up.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse proudly homeported many ships over the years.

meanings.definition: To be based or stationed at a homeport.
meanings.sent1: The fishing boats are homeported along the peaceful coast.
meanings.sent2: The naval fleet is homeported at the naval base.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull homeported on the cruise ship for a free ride.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts always homeported back to his childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The seafaring captain homeported his crew in the quaint village for the winter.
